metadata.title: Create Project README with Setup Instructions

story.soThat: new developers can start contributing quickly
story.tasks: - Create comprehensive README.md file (AC: 1-10) - Write step-by-step setup instructions (AC: 4) - Document available NPM scripts (AC: 5) - Document project structure (AC: 6) - Add documentation references (AC: 7) - Write contribution guidelines (AC: 8) - Document deployment process (AC: 9) - Validate README completeness (AC: 10)

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. README.md includes project description and goals 2. README includes technology stack list (Vite 7.0, React 19.2, TypeScript 5.9, etc.) 3. README includes prerequisites (Node.js 22.x, npm) 4. README includes step-by-step setup instructions: - Clone repository - Install dependencies (`npm install`) - Copy .env.example to .env - Run development server (`npm run dev`) 5. README includes NPM scripts documentation (dev, build, test, lint, etc.) 6. README includes project structure explanation 7. README includes link to architecture.md and PRD.md 8. README includes contribution guidelines 9. README includes deployment instructions (Vercel) 10. Test: New developer can follow README and start app successfully

doc.title: Architecture Decision Document
doc.snippet: Complete architectural decisions for Claine, including platform (PWA), framework (Vite 7.0 + React 19.2 + TypeScript 5.9), database (RxDB + IndexedDB), styling (TailwindCSS 4.0 + shadcn/ui), testing (Vitest 4.0 + Playwright 1.56), and deployment (Vercel). Includes version numbers and technology rationale.

doc.title: Architecture Decision Document
doc.snippet: Details npm create vite command, additional dependencies to install, version specifications (Node.js 22.x required by Vite 7.0), and complete technology stack with exact versions.

doc.title: Epic 0: Infrastructure & Project Setup
doc.snippet: Epic 0 establishes complete project infrastructure. All 10 stories completed (0.1-0.8 done, 0.9 in progress). Includes success criteria: developer can start in <5 minutes, tests pass, CI/CD works, bundle <500KB.

doc.title: Environment Variable Setup Guide
doc.snippet: Comprehensive guide for environment variable setup: copy .env.example to .env, configure variables (VITE_APP_NAME required, VITE_API_URL optional), GitHub Actions secrets, Vercel dashboard configuration. README should reference this document.

doc.title: Story 0.8: Environment Variable Management
doc.section: Learnings from Previous Story & Code Review
doc.snippet: Story 0.8 explicitly deferred README documentation to Story 0.9 (AC6). ENV_SETUP.md created as interim documentation. Environment variable infrastructure complete with .env.example, validation module, and CI/CD integration.

doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: Claine v2 PRD defines AI-powered offline-first email client with local LLM integration, privacy-first architecture, and visual workflow automation.

story-context.constraints: - README.md must be created at project root (not in docs/) - Use GitHub-flavored Markdown syntax - Target audience: new developers unfamiliar with the project - Keep setup instructions simple and sequential (4 main steps) - Reference ENV_SETUP.md for detailed environment variable instructions - All NPM scripts from package.json must be documented - Include Epic 0 success criteria verification (setup in <5 minutes) - Link to existing documentation rather than duplicating content - Document actual project structure (src/features/, src/components/, src/lib/, etc.) - Include badges for build status and deployment - Production URL: https://claine-rebuild-v2.vercel.app

interface.name: npm run scripts
interface.signature: dev - Start Vite development server (port 5173) build - TypeScript compile + Vite build preview - Preview production build locally test - Run Vitest unit tests in watch mode test:run - Run Vitest tests once (CI mode) test:coverage - Run tests with coverage report test:e2e - Run Playwright E2E tests test:e2e:ui - Run Playwright in UI mode lint - Run ESLint on codebase lint:fix - Run ESLint with auto-fix format - Format code with Prettier format:check - Check Prettier formatting

tests.standards: No testing required for README documentation. However, AC10 requires validation that a new developer can follow README successfully. This should be tested manually by: 1. Fresh clone of repository 2. Following README setup instructions exactly 3. Verifying app starts and runs correctly 4. Confirming setup time is under 5 minutes (Epic 0 success criteria)
tests.locations: N/A - Documentation story with no code testing required

ideas.test: Manual validation test: Clone repo in fresh directory, follow README setup steps, verify app runs and displays correctly
Link validation: Check all documentation links in README resolve correctly
NPM script verification: Run each documented script and verify it works as described
Setup timing: Time the complete setup process to confirm <5 minute requirement
